docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 23 (AP) -- The House of Deputies voted today to impeach President Jorge Pacheco Areco but the move failed to obtain the two-thirds majority needed to immediately oust him.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 23 (AP) -- The House of Deputies voted today to impeach President Jorge Pacheco Areco but the move failed to obtain the two-thirds majority needed to immediately oust him.
docs.abstract: House of Deputies votes to impeach Pres Pacheco but fails to obtain 2/3 majority needed to immediately oust him; move spurred by Pacheco s restoration of security measures Cong had annulled; Opposition parties have charged that measures block them from campaigning freely for Nov elections; Sen will consider impeachment in coming wk, 1st time Cong has ever tried to oust a Pres

headline.main: Uruguayan House Votes to Impeach President Pacheco

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 23 -President Salvador Allende Gossens, leader of Chile's left-wing Government, and General Alejandro Agustin Lanusse, Argentina's military President, began a two-day meeting today on a wide range of common problems.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 23 -President Salvador Allende Gossens, leader of Chile's left-wing Government, and General Alejandro Agustin Lanusse, Argentina's military President, began a two-day meeting today on a wide range of common problems.
docs.abstract: Argentine Pres Lanusse plans visit to Peru

headline.main: Leaders of Chile and Argentina Meeting to Discuss Problems

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LIMA, July 27 -- Chile has a Socialist President and Bolivia has a leftist assembly, but the 33-month-old military Government of Peru has gone farther and faster toward decreeing radical social change than its leftist neighbors while remaining hard...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, July 27 -- Chile has a Socialist President and Bolivia has a leftist assembly, but the 33-month-old military Government of Peru has gone farther and faster toward decreeing radical social change than its leftist neighbors while remaining hard to place on the traditional political spectrum.
docs.abstract: Discussion of Peruvian econ system, combination of cooperatives and capitalism, which Peruvians themselves are scrutinizing as they pause to celebrate 150th anniv of country's independence from Spain; illus of preliminary celebrations of anniv

headline.main: Peru Presses Reform by Blending Cooperatives and Capitalism

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SCOTT Publishing Company is revising the format of its 1972 catalogue, long the "bible" of American stamp collectors. It is also revamping its specialist albums -- from hinge-on to the self-contained hingeless (pochette) variety.

docs.snippet: SEATTLE, Aug. 14 -- Scabies, the itchy parasitic skin infection, is resurgent throughout the world, although the reasons are unknown, an American dermatologist has reported.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE, Aug. 14 -- Scabies, the itchy parasitic skin infection, is resurgent throughout the world, although the reasons are unknown, an American dermatologist has reported.
docs.abstract: Dr M Orkin repts scabies, parasitic disease caused by small mites that burrow into skin of cattle, is on rise worldwide for some unknown reasons, rept, AMA Journal; rept detailed; disease and treatment described

headline.main: A MITE INFECTION FOUND INCREASING; Scabies Epidemics Reported in Some Countries
